Llama-3.1-Nemotron-70B-Instruct model stands out not only for its technical performance but also for its business-friendly features. Nvidia\u2019s new open-source AI model offers businesses a flexible and cost-effective alternative to proprietary AI systems.\u00a0 This flexibility is particularly useful for enterprises needing AI models that can adapt to various tasks, from customer service to detailed report generation.\n\nDespite its impressive capabilities, Nvidia has warned that the model may not be fully optimized for specialized domains like mathematics or legal reasoning. As such, businesses will need to ensure they implement appropriate safeguards when using the model in areas requiring high precision.\n\n## Nvidia\u2019s Expanding AI Ambitions\n\nNvidia\u2019s entry into high-performance AI software is part of a broader strategy to offer fully integrated AI solutions. The company recently introduced the NVLM 1.0 family of multimodal models, including the 72-billion-parameter NVLM-D-72B, further showcasing its push into the AI space. These efforts highlight Nvidia\u2019s ambition to compete not only in hardware but also in the broader AI software market.\n\nBy refining Meta\u2019s Llama models and introducing the Nemotron version, Nvidia aims to provide businesses with customizable AI solutions that can be tailored to specific needs. The company is making advanced AI technology more accessible by offering free hosted inference through its platform, build.nvidia.com, complete with an OpenAI-compatible API interface. This move opens the door for a wider range of industries to experiment with and adopt cutting-edge language models.\n\nNvidia\u2019s move into AI software development is likely to accelerate competition in the sector. Other tech giants may need to reconsider their strategies and invest more in research and development to keep pace with Nvidia\u2019s innovations. The introduction of the Llama-3.1-Nemotron-70B-Instruct model could lead to increased collaboration in the AI space, particularly around open-source projects, as companies strive to stay ahead in the race to develop the most advanced AI systems.\n\n## Applications Across Multiple Sectors\n\nDevelopers are excited about the potential applications of Nvidia\u2019s new open-source AI model, particularly in sectors like healthcare and finance.\u00a0 The model\u2019s success will depend on its ability to translate strong benchmark performance into real-world solutions. For businesses, the flexibility and performance of the Llama-3.1-Nemotron-70B-Instruct model could make it an attractive option for streamlining operations and improving customer service.\n\nWhile Nvidia\u2019s new model has garnered attention for its high scores in benchmark tests, its long-term success will depend on how well it performs in practical applications. Nvidia has acknowledged that the model still has limitations in highly specialized fields.\n\nAlso Read: \u301031\u2020iPhone 16 AI Power Could Be Two Years Behind Rivals, Reports Suggest.\u3011\n\n\u301025\u2020Tweet 54\u2020twitter.com\u3011\u301026\u2020Send\u2020api.whatsapp.com\u3011\u301027\u2020Share 15\u2020www.linkedin.com\u3011 \n\n\u301031\u2020 Previous Post iPhone 16 AI Power Could Be Two Years Behind Rivals, Reports Suggest \u3011 \u301032\u2020 Next Post Twitch Bans Several High-Profile Streamers Following TwitchCon Panel \u3011 \n\n###  \u301022\u2020 Reshab Agarwal \u3011 \n\nReshab is a tech-enthusiast who likes to write about all things crypto. Bradley Terry Model: This statistical approach evaluates pairs of responses to determine which is superior, allowing for fine-grained optimization of the model\u2019s output quality.\n\n2. Regression-Style Scoring: By assigning numeric scores based on specific criteria such as helpfulness, accuracy, and relevance, this method provides a more nuanced framework for improving the model\u2019s performance.\n\nThese advanced reward modeling techniques work in tandem to refine the Nemotron 70b\u2019s responses, resulting in more coherent, contextually appropriate, and useful outputs across a wide range of applications.\n\n## Data Set Innovations: HelpSteer 2\n\nA critical factor in the Nemotron 70b\u2019s success is the utilization of the \u301027\u2020HelpSteer 2 data set\u2020huggingface.co\u3011. This innovative training resource combines:\n\n  * Preference rankings for comparative evaluation\n  * Numeric ratings for quantitative assessment\n  * Diverse data sources to capture a wide range of knowledge and contexts\n\nBy integrating these elements, HelpSteer 2 provides a comprehensive framework for training, allowing the Nemotron 70b to learn nuanced patterns and make more informed decisions. This approach enhances the model\u2019s ability to handle complex queries and generate high-quality responses across various domains.\n\n## Performance Benchmarks and Capabilities\n\nThe Nemotron 70b has demonstrated exceptional performance in several key benchmarks:\n\nReward Bench: Outperforming competitors in this metric, which evaluates the model\u2019s ability to generate responses aligned with human preferences.\n\nArena Hard Auto: Excelling in this challenging benchmark, showcasing the model\u2019s advanced reasoning capabilities and adaptability to complex scenarios.\n\nThese results highlight the Nemotron 70b\u2019s potential for tackling intricate tasks with precision and reliability, making it suitable for a wide range of applications in research, industry, and beyond.\n\n## Future Implications and Ongoing Challenges\n\nThe rapid progress demonstrated by the Nemotron 70b and similar open-source models signals a promising future for AI development. As these models continue to evolve, they hold significant potential for:\n\n  * Enhancing AI reasoning and problem-solving capabilities\n  * Improving natural language understanding and generation\n  * Facilitating more intuitive human-AI interactions\n  * Accelerating research and innovation in AI-related fields\n\nHowever, it\u2019s important to acknowledge that challenges remain. The Nemotron 70b, like other AI models, still faces difficulties with certain types of reasoning tasks. Ongoing research and development efforts are focused on addressing these limitations through techniques such as:\n\nPrompt Engineering: Refining the way queries are presented to the model to optimize its performance in specific scenarios.\n\nContinuous Learning: Implementing mechanisms for the model to update and improve its knowledge base over time.\n\nTask-Specific Fine-Tuning: Adapting the model for specialized applications while maintaining its general capabilities.\n\nNVIDIA\u2019s Nemotron 70b represents a significant milestone in open-source AI development. By demonstrating performance that rivals and even surpasses established closed-source models, it sets a new benchmark for what\u2019s possible in the realm of accessible, community-driven AI innovation. As the field continues to evolve, open-source models like the Nemotron 70b are poised to play an increasingly crucial role in shaping the future of artificial intelligence, driving progress through collaboration, transparency, and shared knowledge. "https://cointelegraph.com/news/nvidia-open-source-ai-nemotron-surpasses-open-ai-gpt-4o", "domain": "cointelegraph.com", "text": "\nAccording to a post on X from the Nvidia AI Developer account, the new model, dubbed Llama-3.1-Nemotron-70B-Instruct, \u201cis a leading model\u201d on lmarena.AI\u2019s Chatbot Arena.\u00a0\n\n[Image 2: NVidia, Technology, Meta, ChatGPT, OpenAI]\n\nSource: \u301036\u2020Nvidia AI\u2020x.com\u3011\n\n## Nemotron \n\nLlama-3.1-Nemotron-70B-Instruct is, essentially, a modified version of Meta\u2019s open-source Llama-3.1-70B-Instruct. The \u201cNemotron\u201d portion of the model\u2019s name encapsulates Nvidia\u2019s contribution to the end result.\u00a0\n\nThe Llama \u201cherd\u201d of AI models, as Meta refers to them, are meant to be used as open-source foundations for developers to build on. \n\nIn the case of Nemotron, Nvidia took up the challenge and developed a system designed to be more \u201chelpful\u201d than popular models such as OpenAI\u2019s ChatGPT and Anthropic\u2019s Claude-3.\u00a0\n\nNvidia \u301037\u2020used\u2020build.nvidia.com\u3011 specially curated data sets, advanced fine-tuning methods and its own state-of-the-art AI hardware to turn Meta\u2019s vanilla model into what might be the most \u201chelpful\u201d AI model on the planet.\u00a0\n\n[Image 3: NVidia, Technology, Meta, ChatGPT, OpenAI]\n\nAn engineer\u2019s post on X.com expressing excitement for Nemotron\u2019s capabilities. Source: \u301038\u2020Shayan Taslim\u2020x.com\u3011\n\n## Benchmarking \n\nWhen it comes to determining which AI model is \u201cthe best,\u201d there\u2019s no clear-cut methodology. Unlike, for example, measuring the ambient temperature with a mercury thermometer, there isn\u2019t a single \u201ctruth\u201d that exists when it comes to AI model performance.\u00a0\n\nDevelopers and researchers have to determine how well an AI model performs the same as humans are evaluated \u2014 through comparative testing.\u00a0\n\nRelated: \u301039\u2020AI \u2018mind uploads\u2019 could allow the dead to trade forever\u3011\n\nAI benchmarking involves giving different AI models the same queries, tasks, questions or problems and then comparing the usefulness of the results. Often, due to the subjectivity of what is and isn\u2019t considered useful, human proctors are used to determine a machine\u2019s performance through blind evaluations.\u00a0\n\nIn Nemotron\u2019s case, it appears that Nvidia is claiming the new model outperforms existing state-of-the-art models such as GPT-4o and Claude-3 by a fairly wide margin.\n\n[Image 4: NVidia, Technology, Meta, ChatGPT, OpenAI]\n\nThe top of the Chatbot Arena leaderboards. Source: LLMArena \n\nThe image above depicts the ratings on the automated \u201cHard\u201d test on the Chatbot Arena Leaderboards. While Nvidia\u2019s Llama-3.1-Nemotron-70B-Instruct doesn\u2019t appear to be listed anywhere on the boards, if the developer\u2019s claim that it scored an 85 on this test is valid, it would be the de facto top model in this particular section.\u00a0\n\nWhat makes the achievement perhaps even more interesting is that Llama-3.1-70B is Meta\u2019s middle-tier open-source AI model. There\u2019s a much larger version of Llama-3.1, the 405B version (where the number refers to how many billion parameters the model was tuned with). \n\nBy comparison, GPT-4o is \u301040\u2020estimated\u2020arxiv.org\u3011 to have been developed with over 1 trillion parameters.\n\nMagazine: \u301041\u2020Fake Rabby Wallet scam linked to Dubai crypto CEO and many more victims\u3011\n\n  * \u301042\u2020# NVidia \u3011\n  * \u301043\u2020# Technology \u3011\n  * \u30108\u2020# AI \u3011\n  * \u301044\u2020# Meta \u3011\n  * \u301045\u2020# ChatGPT \u3011\n  * \u301046\u2020# OpenAI \u3011\n\nAdd reaction \n\n[Image 5]\n\nEditor\u2019s Choice \n\n  * \u301047\u2020 Tesla likely still owns $780M in Bitcoin despite recent shuffle: Arkham \u3011\n  * \u301048\u2020 94% of all Bitcoin in profit hints that $69K BTC price was a local top \u3011\n  * \u301049\u2020 Michael Heinrich loves AI coins Goat, Turbo &amp; NVIDIA enhanced this model with advanced fine-tuning and optimization techniques, designed to outperform even highly established models like GPT-4 and Claude-3 in certain benchmarks. The model uses proprietary datasets and state-of-the-art AI hardware, and it ranks highly in comparison tests focused on generating helpful and contextually appropriate responses. NVIDIA&#x27;s contributions to the model, particularly in areas like &quot;reward modeling&quot; and training, significantly improve its reasoning and problem-solving capabilities.\n\nNemotron has been recognized for its strong performance in AI benchmarks, showing superior results in tasks that prioritize human-like responses. While it&#x27;s not the largest model available (Meta also has larger versions), its performance is notable for being more efficient and accessible in the open-source AI ecosystem.\n\nThis release positions NVIDIA as a key player in advancing open-source AI models, potentially rivaling proprietary solutions from other major companies like OpenAI\u30108\u2020source\u3011\u30109\u2020source\u3011."]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true
, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"citations": [{"start_ix": 1158, "end_ix": 1168, "citation_format_type": "tether_og", "metadata": {"type": "webpage", "title": "NVIDIA Nemotron 70b: A Breakthrough in Open-Source AI - Geeky Gadgets", "url": "https://www.geeky-gadgets.com/open-source-ai-nvidia-nemotron-70b/", "text": "  * \u301023\u2020Intel announces support for Microsoft Phi-3 open source AI models\u3011\n  * \u301024\u2020Apple release new open source AI models for on device processing\u3011\n  * \u301025\u2020Mistral-NEXT new open-source model fully tested\u3011\n  * \u301026\u2020NeuralDaredevil-7B open source AI model\u3011\n\n## Innovative Reward Modeling Approaches\n\nTwo pioneering reward modeling techniques contribute significantly to the Nemotron 70b\u2019s capabilities:\n\n1. Bradley Terry Model: This statistical approach evaluates pairs of responses to determine which is superior, allowing for fine-grained optimization of the model\u2019s output quality.\n\n2. Regression-Style Scoring: By assigning numeric scores based on specific criteria such as helpfulness, accuracy, and relevance, this method provides a more nuanced framework for improving the model\u2019s performance.\n\nThese advanced reward modeling techniques work in tandem to refine the Nemotron 70b\u2019s responses, resulting in more coherent, contextually appropriate, and useful outputs across a wide range of applications.\n\n## Data Set Innovations: HelpSteer 2\n\nA critical factor in the Nemotron 70b\u2019s success is the utilization of the \u301027\u2020HelpSteer 2 data set\u2020huggingface.co\u3011. This innovative training resource combines:\n\n  * Preference rankings for comparative evaluation\n  * Numeric ratings for quantitative assessment\n  * Diverse data sources to capture a wide range of knowledge and contexts\n\nBy integrating these elements, HelpSteer 2 provides a comprehensive framework for training, allowing the Nemotron 70b to learn nuanced patterns and make more informed decisions. This approach enhances the model\u2019s ability to handle complex queries and generate high-quality responses across various domains.\n\n## Performance Benchmarks and Capabilities\n\nThe Nemotron 70b has demonstrated exceptional performance in several key benchmarks:\n\nReward Bench: Outperforming competitors in this metric, which evaluates the model\u2019s ability to generate responses aligned with human preferences.\n\nArena Hard Auto: Excelling in this challenging benchmark, showcasing the model\u2019s advanced reasoning capabilities and adaptability to complex scenarios.\n\nThese results highlight the Nemotron 70b\u2019s potential for tackling intricate tasks with precision and reliability, making it suitable for a wide range of applications in research, industry, and beyond.\n\n## Future Implications and Ongoing Challenges\n\nThe rapid progress demonstrated by the Nemotron 70b and similar open-source models signals a promising future for AI development. As these models continue to evolve, they hold significant potential for:\n\n  * Enhancing AI reasoning and problem-solving capabilities\n  * Improving natural language understanding and generation\n  * Facilitating more intuitive human-AI interactions\n  * Accelerating research and innovation in AI-related fields\n\nHowever, it\u2019s important to acknowledge that challenges remain. The Nemotron 70b, like other AI models, still faces difficulties with certain types of reasoning tasks. Ongoing research and development efforts are focused on addressing these limitations through techniques such as:\n\nPrompt Engineering: Refining the way queries are presented to the model to optimize its performance in specific scenarios.\n\nContinuous Learning: Implementing mechanisms for the model to update and improve its knowledge base over time.\n\nTask-Specific Fine-Tuning: Adapting the model for specialized applications while maintaining its general capabilities.\n\nNVIDIA\u2019s Nemotron 70b represents a significant milestone in open-source AI development. By demonstrating performance that rivals and even surpasses established closed-source models, it sets a new benchmark for what\u2019s possible in the realm of accessible, community-driven AI innovation. As the field continues to evolve, open-source models like the Nemotron 70b are poised to play an increasingly crucial role in shaping the future of artificial intelligence, driving progress through collaboration, transparency, and shared knowledge. Bradley Terry Model: This statistical approach evaluates pairs of responses to determine which is superior, allowing for fine-grained optimization of the model\u2019s output quality.\n\n2. Regression-Style Scoring: By assigning numeric scores based on specific criteria such as helpfulness, accuracy, and relevance, this method provides a more nuanced framework for improving the model\u2019s performance.\n\nThese advanced reward modeling techniques work in tandem to refine the Nemotron 70b\u2019s responses, resulting in more coherent, contextually appropriate, and useful outputs across a wide range of applications.\n\n## Data Set Innovations: HelpSteer 2\n\nA critical factor in the Nemotron 70b\u2019s success is the utilization of the \u301027\u2020HelpSteer 2 data set\u2020huggingface.co\u3011. This innovative training resource combines:\n\n  * Preference rankings for comparative evaluation\n  * Numeric ratings for quantitative assessment\n  * Diverse data sources to capture a wide range of knowledge and contexts\n\nBy integrating these elements, HelpSteer 2 provides a comprehensive framework for training, allowing the Nemotron 70b to learn nuanced patterns and make more informed decisions. This approach enhances the model\u2019s ability to handle complex queries and generate high-quality responses across various domains.\n\n## Performance Benchmarks and Capabilities\n\nThe Nemotron 70b has demonstrated exceptional performance in several key benchmarks:\n\nReward Bench: Outperforming competitors in this metric, which evaluates the model\u2019s ability to generate responses aligned with human preferences.\n\nArena Hard Auto: Excelling in this challenging benchmark, showcasing the model\u2019s advanced reasoning capabilities and adaptability to complex scenarios.\n\nThese results highlight the Nemotron 70b\u2019s potential for tackling intricate tasks with precision and reliability, making it suitable for a wide range of applications in research, industry, and beyond.\n\n## Future Implications and Ongoing Challenges\n\nThe rapid progress demonstrated by the Nemotron 70b and similar open-source models signals a promising future for AI development. As these models continue to evolve, they hold significant potential for:\n\n  * Enhancing AI reasoning and problem-solving capabilities\n  * Improving natural language understanding and generation\n  * Facilitating more intuitive human-AI interactions\n  * Accelerating research and innovation in AI-related fields\n\nHowever, it\u2019s important to acknowledge that challenges remain. The Nemotron 70b, like other AI models, still faces difficulties with certain types of reasoning tasks. Ongoing research and development efforts are focused on addressing these limitations through techniques such as:\n\nPrompt Engineering: Refining the way queries are presented to the model to optimize its performance in specific scenarios.\n\nContinuous Learning: Implementing mechanisms for the model to update and improve its knowledge base over time.\n\nTask-Specific Fine-Tuning: Adapting the model for specialized applications while maintaining its general capabilities.\n\nNVIDIA\u2019s Nemotron 70b represents a significant milestone in open-source AI development. By demonstrating performance that rivals and even surpasses established closed-source models, it sets a new benchmark for what\u2019s possible in the realm of accessible, community-driven AI innovation. As the field continues to evolve, open-source models like the Nemotron 70b are poised to play an increasingly crucial role in shaping the future of artificial intelligence, driving progress through collaboration, transparency, and shared knowledge. AI\u2020x.com\u3011\n\n## Nemotron \n\nLlama-3.1-Nemotron-70B-Instruct is, essentially, a modified version of Meta\u2019s open-source Llama-3.1-70B-Instruct. The \u201cNemotron\u201d portion of the model\u2019s name encapsulates Nvidia\u2019s contribution to the end result.\u00a0\n\nThe Llama \u201cherd\u201d of AI models, as Meta refers to them, are meant to be used as open-source foundations for developers to build on. \n\nIn the case of Nemotron, Nvidia took up the challenge and developed a system designed to be more \u201chelpful\u201d than popular models such as OpenAI\u2019s ChatGPT and Anthropic\u2019s Claude-3.\u00a0\n\nNvidia \u301037\u2020used\u2020build.nvidia.com\u3011 specially curated data sets, advanced fine-tuning methods and its own state-of-the-art AI hardware to turn Meta\u2019s vanilla model into what might be the most \u201chelpful\u201d AI model on the planet.\u00a0\n\n[Image 3: NVidia, Technology, Meta, ChatGPT, OpenAI]\n\nAn engineer\u2019s post on X.com expressing excitement for Nemotron\u2019s capabilities. Source: \u301038\u2020Shayan Taslim\u2020x.com\u3011\n\n## Benchmarking \n\nWhen it comes to determining which AI model is \u201cthe best,\u201d there\u2019s no clear-cut methodology. Unlike, for example, measuring the ambient temperature with a mercury thermometer, there isn\u2019t a single \u201ctruth\u201d that exists when it comes to AI model performance.\u00a0\n\nDevelopers and researchers have to determine how well an AI model performs the same as humans are evaluated \u2014 through comparative testing.\u00a0\n\nRelated: \u301039\u2020AI \u2018mind uploads\u2019 could allow the dead to trade forever\u3011\n\nAI benchmarking involves giving different AI models the same queries, tasks, questions or problems and then comparing the usefulness of the results. Often, due to the subjectivity of what is and isn\u2019t considered useful, human proctors are used to determine a machine\u2019s performance through blind evaluations.\u00a0\n\nIn Nemotron\u2019s case, it appears that Nvidia is claiming the new model outperforms existing state-of-the-art models such as GPT-4o and Claude-3 by a fairly wide margin.\n\n[Image 4: NVidia, Technology, Meta, ChatGPT, OpenAI]\n\nThe top of the Chatbot Arena leaderboards. Source: LLMArena \n\nThe image above depicts the ratings on the automated \u201cHard\u201d test on the Chatbot Arena Leaderboards. The \u201cNemotron\u201d portion of the model\u2019s name encapsulates Nvidia\u2019s contribution to the end result.\u00a0\n\nThe Llama \u201cherd\u201d of AI models, as Meta refers to them, are meant to be used as open-source foundations for developers to build on. \n\nIn the case of Nemotron, Nvidia took up the challenge and developed a system designed to be more \u201chelpful\u201d than popular models such as OpenAI\u2019s ChatGPT and Anthropic\u2019s Claude-3.\u00a0\n\nNvidia \u301037\u2020used\u2020build.nvidia.com\u3011 specially curated data sets, advanced fine-tuning methods and its own state-of-the-art AI hardware to turn Meta\u2019s vanilla model into what might be the most \u201chelpful\u201d AI model on the planet.\u00a0\n\n[Image 3: NVidia, Technology, Meta, ChatGPT, OpenAI]\n\nAn engineer\u2019s post on X.com expressing excitement for Nemotron\u2019s capabilities. Source: \u301038\u2020Shayan Taslim\u2020x.com\u3011\n\n## Benchmarking \n\nWhen it comes to determining which AI model is \u201cthe best,\u201d there\u2019s no clear-cut methodology. Unlike, for example, measuring the ambient temperature with a mercury thermometer, there isn\u2019t a single \u201ctruth\u201d that exists when it comes to AI model performance.\u00a0\n\nDevelopers and researchers have to determine how well an AI model performs the same as humans are evaluated \u2014 through comparative testing.\u00a0\n\nRelated: \u301039\u2020AI \u2018mind uploads\u2019 could allow the dead to trade forever\u3011\n\nAI benchmarking involves giving different AI models the same queries, tasks, questions or problems and then comparing the usefulness of the results. Often, due to the subjectivity of what is and isn\u2019t considered useful, human proctors are used to determine a machine\u2019s performance through blind evaluations.\u00a0\n\nIn Nemotron\u2019s case, it appears that Nvidia is claiming the new model outperforms existing state-of-the-art models such as GPT-4o and Claude-3 by a fairly wide margin.\n\n[Image 4: NVidia, Technology, Meta, ChatGPT, OpenAI]\n\nThe top of the Chatbot Arena leaderboards. Source: LLMArena \n\nThe image above depicts the ratings on the automated \u201cHard\u201d test on the Chatbot Arena Leaderboards. While Nvidia\u2019s Llama-3.1-Nemotron-70B-Instruct doesn\u2019t appear to be listed anywhere on the boards, if the developer\u2019s claim that it scored an 85 on this test is valid, it would be the de facto top model in this particular section.\u00a0\n\nWhat makes the achievement perhaps even more interesting is that Llama-3.1-70B is Meta\u2019s middle-tier open-source AI model. There\u2019s a much larger version of Llama-3.1, the 405B version (where the number refers to how many billion parameters the model was tuned with). \n\nBy comparison, GPT-4o is \u301040\u2020estimated\u2020arxiv.org\u3011 to have been developed with over 1 trillion parameters.\n\nMagazine: \u301041\u2020Fake Rabby Wallet scam linked to Dubai crypto CEO and many more victims\u3011\n\n  * \u301042\u2020# NVidia \u3011\n  * \u301043\u2020# Technology \u3011\n  * \u30108\u2020# AI \u3011\n  * \u301044\u2020# Meta \u3011\n  * \u301045\u2020# ChatGPT \u3011\n  * \u301046\u2020# OpenAI \u3011\n\nAdd reaction \n\n[Image 5]\n\nEditor\u2019s Choice \n\n  * \u301047\u2020 Tesla likely still owns $780M in Bitcoin despite recent shuffle: Arkham \u3011\n  * \u301048\u2020 94% of all Bitcoin in profit hints that $69K BTC price was a local top \u3011\n  * \u301049\u2020 Michael Heinrich loves AI coins Goat, Turbo &amp; Bradley Terry Model: This statistical approach evaluates pairs of responses to determine which is superior, allowing for fine-grained optimization of the model\u2019s output quality.\n\n2. Regression-Style Scoring: By assigning numeric scores based on specific criteria such as helpfulness, accuracy, and relevance, this method provides a more nuanced framework for improving the model\u2019s performance.\n\nThese advanced reward modeling techniques work in tandem to refine the Nemotron 70b\u2019s responses, resulting in more coherent, contextually appropriate, and useful outputs across a wide range of applications.\n\n## Data Set Innovations: HelpSteer 2\n\nA critical factor in the Nemotron 70b\u2019s success is the utilization of the \u301027\u2020HelpSteer 2 data set\u2020huggingface.co\u3011. This innovative training resource combines:\n\n  * Preference rankings for comparative evaluation\n  * Numeric ratings for quantitative assessment\n  * Diverse data sources to capture a wide range of knowledge and contexts\n\nBy integrating these elements, HelpSteer 2 provides a comprehensive framework for training, allowing the Nemotron 70b to learn nuanced patterns and make more informed decisions. This approach enhances the model\u2019s ability to handle complex queries and generate high-quality responses across various domains.\n\n## Performance Benchmarks and Capabilities\n\nThe Nemotron 70b has demonstrated exceptional performance in several key benchmarks:\n\nReward Bench: Outperforming competitors in this metric, which evaluates the model\u2019s ability to generate responses aligned with human preferences.\n\nArena Hard Auto: Excelling in this challenging benchmark, showcasing the model\u2019s advanced reasoning capabilities and adaptability to complex scenarios.\n\nThese results highlight the Nemotron 70b\u2019s potential for tackling intricate tasks with precision and reliability, making it suitable for a wide range of applications in research, industry, and beyond.\n\n## Future Implications and Ongoing Challenges\n\nThe rapid progress demonstrated by the Nemotron 70b and similar open-source models signals a promising future for AI development. As these models continue to evolve, they hold significant potential for:\n\n  * Enhancing AI reasoning and problem-solving capabilities\n  * Improving natural language understanding and generation\n  * Facilitating more intuitive human-AI interactions\n  * Accelerating research and innovation in AI-related fields\n\nHowever, it\u2019s important to acknowledge that challenges remain. The Nemotron 70b, like other AI models, still faces difficulties with certain types of reasoning tasks. Ongoing research and development efforts are focused on addressing these limitations through techniques such as:\n\nPrompt Engineering: Refining the way queries are presented to the model to optimize its performance in specific scenarios.\n\nContinuous Learning: Implementing mechanisms for the model to update and improve its knowledge base over time.\n\nTask-Specific Fine-Tuning: Adapting the model for specialized applications while maintaining its general capabilities.\n\nNVIDIA\u2019s Nemotron 70b represents a significant milestone in open-source AI development. By demonstrating performance that rivals and even surpasses established closed-source models, it sets a new benchmark for what\u2019s possible in the realm of accessible, community-driven AI innovation. As the field continues to evolve, open-source models like the Nemotron 70b are poised to play an increasingly crucial role in shaping the future of artificial intelligence, driving progress through collaboration, transparency, and shared knowledge. You ask thoughtful, specific questions, and it&#x27;s clear you&#x27;re focused on maximizing the usefulness of our interactions. However, if you&#x27;d like to refine your prompts for even more productive conversations, here are a few tips:\n\n### 1. **Be as Specific as Possible**\n   - **Current Example**: You do this well when you&#x27;re asking about AI models, specific coding questions, or work-related inquiries.\n   - **Tip**: Keep adding context about what you&#x27;re looking for or any constraints you have (like needing a cloud solution because your local machine isn&#x27;t powerful enough). This helps me provide tailored advice faster.\n   \n### 2. **State Your Objective Clearly**\n   - **Example**: When you&#x27;re seeking advice on building an AI portfolio or learning AI skills, stating the exact outcome you&#x27;re hoping for (like getting a job or specific certifications) helps guide the advice better.\n   - **Improved Prompt**: Instead of &quot;Can I run Llama 3 on my computer?&quot;, you could ask, &quot;Given my setup, what are my options for running large AI models like Llama-3, either locally or on the cloud?&quot;\n   \n### 3. **Use Open-Ended Follow-ups**\n   - Sometimes, it&#x27;s useful to add open-ended prompts to let the conversation flow in unexpected directions.\n   - **Example**: After asking about AI models, you might follow up with &quot;What other advancements in AI should I be aware of that could impact job prospects?&quot; This opens the door for me to offer insights beyond the specific question.\n\n### 4. **Clarify Assumptions**\n   - If you&#x27;re unsure about certain facts or frameworks, mention your assumptions. I can clarify them or guide you to the right understanding.\n   - **Example**: &quot;I assume I need a powerful GPU to run Llama models locally\u2014am I right?&quot;\n\n### 5. **Feedback for Continuous Learning**\n   - Regularly asking for clarification or feedback on my responses helps refine the conversation.\n   - **Example**: &quot;Can you explain how reward modeling works in simpler terms?&quot; This helps fine-tune technical responses to match your understanding level.\n\n### 6. **Break Big Questions into Smaller Parts**\n   - When a topic is broad, breaking it into smaller parts can help me address specific concerns more efficiently.\n   - **Example**: &quot;What AI-related projects could I work on to boost my resume?&quot; followed by &quot;How can I showcase those projects effectively in interviews?&quot;\n\nIn summary, you&#x27;re already doing great, but adding more **specific objectives**, **open-ended follow-ups**, and **clarifications on assumptions** could make our chats even more insightful. Here\u2019s a breakdown of how to design the prompt:\n\n### 1. **Contextual Awareness**  \n   You want the GPT to understand that it\u2019s working from your resume and that it must tailor this resume to fit the specific job posting. The first part of the prompt should set that stage.\n\n   Example:  \n   &quot;You have access to my resume and can modify it. I will provide you with a job posting, and you will analyze the key qualifications, skills, and experiences that the employer is looking for.&quot;\n\n### 2. **ATS Optimization Requirements**  \n   Applicant Tracking Systems often filter resumes based on **keywords** and **formatting**. Your prompt should instruct the GPT to focus on including the right **keywords** and ensuring the resume is **formatted** correctly for ATS.\n\n   Example:  \n   &quot;Please generate an ATS-friendly version of my resume, ensuring it includes relevant keywords from the job posting. Optimize for clarity, use bullet points for experiences, and avoid graphics, tables, or excessive formatting that ATS systems might struggle with.&quot;\n\n### 3. **Customization for Role-Specific Matches**  \n   You want the GPT to highlight your skills and experiences that are the best match for the job.\n\n   Example:  \n   &quot;Focus on matching the job requirements with my work experience and skills. Rephrase or emphasize the most relevant aspects of my background so it\u2019s clear to the recruiter that I\u2019m the perfect fit for the role. Make sure to quantify achievements wherever possible, and use active, outcome-oriented language.&quot;\n\n### Example Prompt Structure:\n&quot;Hello GPT! I want you to create an ATS-optimized resume for me. You already have my resume on hand, and I will provide you with the job description for the role I\u2019m applying for. \n\nHere\u2019s how I want you to process it:\n1. Analyze the job posting and identify the key skills, qualifications, and responsibilities the employer is looking for.\n2. Optimize my resume by incorporating relevant keywords from the job description into my existing experience and skills sections.\n3. Tailor each job role in my resume to align with the responsibilities outlined in the job posting.\n4. Ensure the resume is in a simple, ATS-friendly format (e.g., no graphics, tables, or unconventional fonts).\n5. Highlight quantifiable achievements and use strong, active language to make it clear that I\u2019m the best candidate for the role.&quot;\n\n### Possible Follow-ups:\n- &quot;What keywords should I prioritize for this job description?&quot;\n- &quot;Could you improve the bullet points for the &#x27;Customer Success Manager&#x27; role to emphasize team leadership and communication?&quot;\n\nThis approach will ensure your GPT is focused on crafting a tailored, keyword-optimized resume that aligns with job postings and is formatted to pass through ATS filters effectively. 1729670923.910335, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Your point about **compartmentalization** is insightful! The architecture of GPT models, including mine, emphasizes task-based processing for a few key reasons:\n\n### 1. **Focus and Clarity**\nCompartmentalizing different aspects of a task helps ensure that responses are concise and relevant to the specific query at hand. This approach allows the model to remain focused on the immediate context, without getting overwhelmed by the vast amount of data it has access to. It mirrors human cognitive processes, where we also break down complex tasks into manageable parts.\n\n### 2. **Modularity for Performance**\nGPT models are trained to respond to specific input patterns based on the context they&#x27;re given at any moment. By keeping interactions modular, the system can perform efficiently without overloading any one component with too much information. This division allows the model to handle diverse tasks (coding, answering questions, etc.) without confusion.\n\n### 3. **Security and Privacy**\nCompartmentalization also aids in ensuring that information isn&#x27;t unintentionally leaked across sessions or queries. For example, conversations don&#x27;t carry over unless explicitly designed to, which minimizes the risk of cross-query contamination.\n\n### 4. **Flexibility and Adaptability**\nIn models like mine, compartmentalization helps deal with a wide variety of tasks. It allows me to respond to everything from coding questions to creative writing in a way that is adaptable. Think of it like having specialized &quot;modules&quot; or &quot;zones&quot; for different types of reasoning.\n\n### Internal Integration\nThat said, you&#x27;re absolutely right: more **integration** could lead to more fluid and contextually rich conversations, especially for personalizing interactions. There are research initiatives aimed at adding **long-term memory** and more contextual awareness to AI models so they can keep track of ongoing projects, conversations, and preferences over time. For example, tools like **LangChain** or **LlamaIndex** enable models to retain context for better long-term interaction. This could be useful for tasks like generating optimized resumes from saved data, as you mentioned.\n\nIf I had more persistent memory across all tasks (similar to how the OpenAI GPT builder can be customized with long-term memory or specific capabilities), I could indeed act more like a continuous assistant who evolves with your needs.\n\nWould you be interested in exploring how to make your personal GPT model better at retaining context and integrating tasks? It can help your model retain a &quot;state,&quot; enabling it to remember your resume, preferences, and ongoing job searches. This would allow the GPT to reference previous conversations or details (like your resume) without needing constant re-prompting.\n  \n  **How to use it:**\n   - LangChain can store long-term memory by creating an interaction history. This history allows your GPT model to pull relevant details from past conversations, enhancing contextual understanding.\n   - You could integrate a knowledge base of your resume into the system, and when you provide a job posting, the model could recall and tweak specific sections (e.g., your software experience) to align with the job&#x27;s requirements.\n\n   **LangChain Resources:**\n   - [LangChain Documentation](https://langchain.readthedocs.io/en/latest/)\n\n### 2. **Embedding and Retrieval Models**\n   - Use **embedding-based retrieval models** to store and retrieve sections of your resume or past data. By indexing your resume and job descriptions using embeddings, you can have the GPT access relevant sections, contextualize them, and generate a custom response.\n   - For instance, **FAISS** (Facebook AI Similarity Search) is a tool that could store parts of your resume and relevant keywords, making it searchable by the GPT when needed. You\u2019d query the job posting, and FAISS retrieves the most relevant parts of your resume for the GPT to customize.\n\n   **How to use it:**\n   - Store each section of your resume (education, experience, skills) as embeddings. When a job description is provided, the model searches for relevant parts based on the job\u2019s keywords and modifies the resume dynamically.\n\n   **FAISS Resources:**\n   - [FAISS GitHub](https://github.com/facebookresearch/faiss)\n\n### 3. **Fine-Tuning on Your Resume Data**\n   - You can **fine-tune** your GPT on a dataset that includes variations of your resume. This makes it better suited for identifying and repurposing your experience for different job types. Fine-tuning can include making the model aware of common ATS-friendly formats and tailoring language to meet specific industry standards.\n   - **Example process**:\n     - Create a small dataset of job descriptions and your tailored resumes.\n     - Fine-tune the GPT model on these data samples, ensuring it learns how to automatically align your experience with various job roles.\n\n   **Fine-Tuning Resources:**\n   - [OpenAI Fine-Tuning Guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/fine-tuning)\n\n### 4. **Prompt Engineering for Contextual Generation**\n   - Craft your prompts to take advantage of **few-shot learning**. By giving the model structured examples of how you like your resume to be tailored for specific roles, you can achieve more consistent results without needing complex infrastructure.\n   \n   Example prompt structure:\n   ```\n   I\u2019m applying for [Job Title] at [Company]. Here&#x27;s a list of job requirements: [insert job requirements]. Here&#x27;s my resume: [insert key details from your resume]. Please generate an ATS-optimized resume that emphasizes my skills related to [specific job focus areas].\n   ```\n   This structured input can guide the GPT to highlight the relevant parts of your resume for each job.\n\n### 5. **Use GPT-3&#x27;s Embedding Models via API**\n   OpenAI offers powerful embedding models that let you semantically search through documents (like your resume) and retrieve the most relevant sections based on a query (the job posting).\n   \n   **How to use it:**\n   - Store sections of your resume in an embedding-based system. When you feed a job posting into the GPT, it uses the embeddings to fetch and reorganize the parts of your resume that match best with the job description.\n\n   **OpenAI Embedding Resources**:\n   - [Embeddings API](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/embeddings)\n\n### 6. **Automation with Tools like Zapier or Integromat**\n   - For ease of use, you could automate the process of feeding job descriptions and generating custom resumes. You can integrate GPT with **Zapier** or **Integromat** to automatically pull job postings from emails or job boards, process them, and generate a customized resume, all without manual intervention.\n\n   **How to use it:**\n   - Set up a Zap to trigger whenever you receive a job posting in your email.\n   - Zapier feeds this into your GPT, and the GPT responds with a tailored resume, which is then automatically emailed back to you.\n\n   **Zapier Resources**:\n   - [Zapier GPT Integration](https://zapier.com/apps/openai/integrations)\n\n### Combining Everything\n- **Long-term memory** with LangChain or LlamaIndex would ensure your GPT retains your resume.\n- **Embeddings and FAISS** would enable smart retrieval based on job descriptions.\n- **Prompt engineering** and **fine-tuning** help your GPT improve over time by learning from different roles you apply to.\n- **Automation** ensures this process is smooth and hands-off.\n\nThese strategies will allow your personal GPT to seamlessly access, modify, and optimize your resume based on job postings, giving you an edge in the job application process. Let me know which parts you&#x27;d like more details or guidance on!"]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true

Here\u2019s how to start:\n   - Log into **OpenAI GPT Builder**.\n   - Create a new GPT instance.\n   - In the GPT builder, you can **add a memory module** where you upload your resume. This will allow the model to access and store your resume for reference in future interactions.\n\n### 2. **Load Resume into GPT Memory**\n   Since we already have your resume, you can:\n   - Upload it directly into the builder as part of its memory.\n   - If the builder doesn&#x27;t directly support large uploads or memory, chunk your resume into smaller sections (e.g., **Work Experience**, **Education**, **Skills**) and feed them to the model as part of its knowledge base.\n   \n### 3. **Customize Prompts for ATS-Optimized Resumes**\n   Create prompt templates like:\n   - &quot;Generate an ATS-optimized resume for the following job posting: [Insert job description]. Use my resume as reference and customize the skills and experiences to align with the job requirements.&quot;\n   \n   Fine-tuning the prompts in this way will ensure that every interaction results in a resume that matches specific job postings.\n\n### 4. **Configure Long-Term Memory (via GPT Builder or External Tool)**\n   Since you want this model to **remember** details long-term, you\u2019ll likely need to use a memory module or tool like **LangChain** or **LlamaIndex**, which can store your ongoing interactions.\n   - You can integrate these into your GPT builder setup (if possible) or use them to feed memory/context back to the GPT for more complex workflows.\n   \n   You might not need external tools for GPT Builder depending on how it handles long-term memory, but this is something you should explore if deeper memory is needed.\n\n### 5. **Automate with API/Workflow Integrations**\n   Set up workflows for:\n   - **Retrieving job descriptions** automatically (from job boards, emails, etc.).\n   - **Generating resumes** based on job postings and having them ready to submit.\n   \n   This can be done with **Zapier** or **Integromat** to automate the input/output process.\n\n### 6. **Stay in Sync with Me!**\n   Even though this builder GPT will handle the specific tasks, we can still chat here for guidance, advice, and ideas. You can even **import some of our past conversations** to reflect our previous chats and keep the same vibe going in your custom GPT.\n\n### Final Steps\n- **Start building your custom GPT**: Take these steps and build the initial framework. 1728711882.275987, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Decarbing (decarboxylating) sage before using it to create an alcohol-based tincture, such as with the Green Dragon method, would potentially enhance and alter some of the active compounds in the sage, creating distinct effects in the tincture. Here are the likely effects and components to consider:\n\n1. **Altered Phytochemicals**: \n   - Decarboxylation typically involves heating the herb, which can change some of its chemical constituents. Sage contains thujone, rosmarinic acid, camphor, and other essential oils. Decarbing may increase the availability of some of these compounds, potentially making the tincture more potent. \n   - **Thujone**, found in sage, has a stimulant effect in low doses, but excessive amounts can cause adverse reactions. Decarbing could increase thujone\u2019s presence, leading to stronger effects.\n\n2. **Increased Antioxidant Activity**: \n   - Sage is known for its antioxidant properties, largely due to rosmarinic acid. Decarbing may intensify these effects, resulting in a tincture with enhanced potential for combating oxidative stress and promoting cellular health.\n\n3. **Potential Cognitive Benefits**: \n   - Sage has been historically associated with improving memory and cognitive function. A decarbed tincture might amplify these effects, making it more effective for improving focus or memory due to the enhanced availability of sage&#x27;s active compounds.\n\n4. **Anti-inflammatory Properties**: \n   - Rosmarinic acid and other components in sage have anti-inflammatory properties, and a decarbed tincture could heighten the herb&#x27;s ability to reduce inflammation, offering potential relief from inflammatory conditions.\n\n5. **Stronger Flavor and Aroma**: \n   - Decarbing can intensify the herb&#x27;s flavor and aroma by releasing more volatile compounds, leading to a tincture with a more pronounced herbal, earthy, and potentially bitter taste.\n\n6. **Possible Psychoactive Effects**: \n   - Thujone, in higher concentrations, is known to have psychoactive effects and may cause altered mental states, hallucinations, or convulsions in excessive amounts. The Green Dragon method, particularly with decarbed sage, could lead to a tincture with mild to moderate psychoactive properties if thujone levels are concentrated.\n\n7. **Antibacterial and Antifungal Effects**: \n   - Sage is antimicrobial, and a tincture could be effective as a topical or internal remedy for bacterial or fungal infections, with decarbing enhancing the tincture\u2019s efficacy in this regard.\n\n8. **Enhanced Mood and Relaxation**: \n   - Sage has anxiolytic (anxiety-reducing) effects. Decarbing may heighten its potential to relieve stress and promote relaxation, contributing to a more potent mood-stabilizing tincture.\n\nIt is important to note that while decarbing could amplify the effects of sage, there\u2019s a risk of intensifying compounds like thujone, which should be taken cautiously, especially in larger doses. If using sage in this way, it\u2019s recommended to use small amounts initially to gauge the effects."]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true

A commonly used herb-to-alcohol ratio for tinctures is **1:2 to 1:5** for fresh herbs. Here\u2019s a breakdown:\n\n### Suggested Ratio:\n- **1:2 ratio (for a stronger tincture)**: For every 1 gram of fresh sage, use 2 mL of alcohol.\n- **1:5 ratio (for a milder tincture)**: For every 1 gram of fresh sage, use 5 mL of alcohol.\n\nSince you\u2019re using **96% alcohol** (a very high concentration), it will effectively extract the active components, but you can adjust based on the potency you\u2019re looking for.\n\n### Example:\n- For **50 grams** of fresh sage:\n  - In a **1:2 ratio**: Use 100 mL of 96% alcohol.\n  - In a **1:5 ratio**: Use 250 mL of 96% alcohol.\n\nYou can start with a 1:5 ratio if you prefer a less concentrated tincture and adjust according to your desired potency as you experiment. Fresh sage has a high water content, so if you&#x27;re using 96% alcohol, you might not need to worry much about dilution during extraction.\n\nLet it sit in a dark place for at least **2-4 weeks**, shaking it every day, and then strain it to get the tincture. It may cause euphoria, creativity, or introspective effects depending on the dose. At higher doses, it may induce psychoactive effects like heightened awareness or altered sensory perception.\n   - **Sage (Thujone)**: Sage contains thujone, which, in small amounts, has a stimulating effect on the nervous system. This could potentially enhance focus, memory, and clarity when combined with the right cannabis strain.\n   - **Combined Effect**: Depending on the strain, this combination may create a sense of alertness while being relaxed, which could be useful for focus-driven tasks or creative work.\n\n### 3. **Potential Psychoactive Effects**\n   - **Cannabis (THC)**: Cannabis\u2019 psychoactive effects, driven by THC, can range from mild euphoria to more intense states depending on the dose.\n   - **Sage (Thujone)**: High amounts of thujone may add to the psychoactive effects of THC, potentially resulting in heightened mental stimulation or mild hallucinations in high doses. This combination should be used with caution as it may enhance the intensity of a cannabis high.\n   \n### 4. **Anti-inflammatory and Pain Relief**\n   - **Cannabis (CBD/THC)**: Cannabis, especially strains high in CBD, is known for its anti-inflammatory and pain-relieving properties. "message": { "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1728712756.840038, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["If the tincture is typically consumed in beverages like instant tea or coffee, there are a few additional considerations for how the effects might be influenced by these drinks:\n\n### 1. **Enhanced Absorption Due to Heat**\n   - **Heat from Tea or Coffee**: Warm beverages can help dilate blood vessels, potentially leading to quicker absorption of the tincture. This may cause the effects of the tincture (such as relaxation, mood improvement, or cognitive clarity) to be felt faster than if it were taken with a cold drink or on its own.\n   - **Cannabinoids and Heat**: Most cannabinoids are not significantly degraded by the temperature of a warm drink, so the therapeutic effects should remain intact.\n\n### 2. **Synergistic Effects with Caffeine**\n   - **Caffeine in Coffee/Tea**: Caffeine is a natural stimulant that can enhance focus and mental alertness. When combined with a cannabis and sage tincture, particularly one with low THC, the caffeine could amplify the **cognitive clarity, focus, and energy** provided by cannabinoids like CBD and CBG, and by sage&#x27;s thujone.\n   - **Balancing Stimulation**: For some, this combination might create a nice balance of stimulation and relaxation, reducing anxiety that sometimes accompanies caffeine consumption. However, if the tincture is taken in a higher dose or is particularly sedative, it might counteract the energizing effects of the caffeine.\n\n### 3. **Flavor Considerations**\n   - **Bitterness of Sage**: Sage has a strong, earthy, and somewhat bitter taste, which may be more pronounced when added to coffee or tea. Depending on your taste preference, you might want to adjust the amount of tincture or add sweeteners (like honey, sugar, or flavored syrups) to balance the bitterness.\n   - **Herbal Complement to Tea**: If added to tea, especially herbal blends, sage may complement certain flavors quite well (e.g., chamomile, green tea, or mint).\n\n### 4. **Digestive Support**\n   - **Sage and Coffee**: Sage&#x27;s digestive support properties, combined with the stimulant effects of coffee, might help stimulate digestion. This could be beneficial for those who drink coffee and experience mild digestive discomfort, as sage and cannabinoids (especially CBD) are both known to soothe the digestive tract.\n   - **Tea and Sage for Digestion**: If consumed in tea, particularly herbal teas with ingredients like ginger or peppermint, the tincture could help reduce nausea or digestive discomfort, especially when consumed after meals.\n\n### 5. **Slight Alteration of the Sedative Effects**\n   - **Caffeine&#x27;s Effect on Sedation**: If the tincture has any sedative properties (e.g., due to cannabinoids or terpenes like myrcene), the caffeine in coffee or tea may reduce the sedative effects, creating a balance where the user feels calm but not sleepy.\n   - **Timing of Consumption**: If you&#x27;re aiming for a more relaxing or sedative effect, consuming the tincture with a non-caffeinated beverage, like herbal tea, might be a better option, particularly in the evening.\n\n### Conclusion:\n- **Faster onset**: Heat from the beverage may speed up absorption.\n- **Balanced effects**: The caffeine could enhance focus and mental clarity, complementing the relaxing properties of the tincture.\n- **Flavor**: Bitter sage flavors could stand out, so adjusting sweetness in the drink may be helpful.\n- **Digestive support**: The combination of sage, cannabinoids, and warm beverages can help soothe digestion.\n\nThis practice of mixing the tincture into instant tea or coffee could offer a pleasant and quick way to experience the tincture&#x27;s effects, especially if you&#x27;re looking for focus and relaxation in balance with your daily caffeine routine."]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true

It also has mild anxiolytic (anxiety-reducing) properties, which can promote mental clarity while keeping the mind calm.\n   - **Mild Relaxation**: Sage can promote **relaxation without sedation**, making it a good base for a tincture focused on **daytime mood support** and **stress reduction**.\n\n### 2. **Kanna (Sceletium tortuosum)**\n   - **Mood Enhancement and Relaxation**: Kanna is a powerful herb for managing **mood** and **anxiety**, promoting **euphoria** and **stress relief**. It could provide a similar **mood-boosting effect** to THC, especially in higher doses, without the psychoactive effects.\n   - **Stress Relief**: Kanna interacts with the serotonin system, making it an excellent herb for managing **depression and anxiety** while helping the user feel emotionally balanced and calm.\n\n### 3. **Rosemary (Rosmarinus officinalis)**\n   - **Mental Clarity and Relaxation**: Rosemary is often used to enhance **cognitive function**, and it promotes **relaxation and mental clarity** without sedation, similar to sage.\n   - **Energizing Calm**: Rosemary can provide an **uplifting, yet calming effect**, making it helpful for replacing daytime THC products aimed at **focus and mood improvement**.\n\n### 4. **Lemon Balm (Melissa officinalis)**\n   - **Calming and Anti-Anxiety**: Lemon balm is well known for its **calming properties** and is often used to relieve **anxiety** and **promote relaxation**. It has a mild **mood-lifting** effect and could be useful in combination with other herbs for easing into **sleep**.\n   - **Sleep Support**: In higher doses, lemon balm promotes **deeper sleep** without the heavy sedation of THC, making it a great replacement for **evening use**.\n\n### 5. **Passionflower (Passiflora incarnata)**\n   - **Anxiety Reduction and Relaxation**: Passionflower is effective for reducing **anxiety** and promoting **deep relaxation**, making it a suitable replacement for THC when relaxation or sleep support is needed.\n   - **Sleep Aid**: Passionflower works similarly to THC for promoting **calmness and deep sleep**, helping to replace the sleep-enhancing effects of THC-based products.\n\n### 6. **Ashwagandha (Withania somnifera)**\n   - **Stress Relief and Calm Energy**: Ashwagandha is a powerful adaptogen that helps the body cope with **stress**. It can promote **calm energy** and reduce feelings of anxiety without sedation.\n   - **Mood Enhancement**: Ashwagandha can help improve **mood and emotional resilience**, making it a good long-term replacement for the mood-stabilizing effects of THC.\n\n### 7. **Valerian Root (Valeriana officinalis)**\n   - **Sedative and Sleep Aid**: Valerian root is a more direct replacement for THC\u2019s **sleep-inducing properties**. While the effects might not fully replicate the euphoria of THC, this tincture can still offer **calm, mild euphoria, relaxation**, and **creative stimulation**.\n\n### Supermarket-Friendly Herb Tincture Recipe\n\nHere are some easily sourced herbs that can still provide **relaxation**, **creativity**, and **mood enhancement**:\n\n1. **Sage (Salvia officinalis)** \u2013 Readily available and known for its **cognitive-enhancing** and **calming effects**. It can help with **focus, introspection**, and **mental clarity**.\n   \n2. **Rosemary (Rosmarinus officinalis)** \u2013 Also easy to find and is great for improving **memory, creativity**, and **mental clarity**. It\u2019s mildly **energizing** but also helps reduce **stress**.\n\n3. **Basil (Ocimum basilicum)** \u2013 Known for its **mood-lifting** properties and mild **euphoria**. Basil promotes **relaxation** and **focus**.\n\n4. **Thyme (Thymus vulgaris)** \u2013 Provides **mental clarity** and **stress relief** while supporting **relaxation**. It can be calming and help with **mood stability**.\n\n5. **Lemon Balm (Melissa officinalis)** \u2013 Although not always available at all supermarkets, **lemon balm** is becoming more common in grocery stores and provides **anxiety relief** and **calm energy**, as well as supporting **sleep**. If not available, you can substitute it with **mint**, which also offers **calming effects**.\n\n### Ingredients:\n- **20 grams fresh sage**\n- **20 grams fresh rosemary**\n- **20 grams fresh basil**\n- **15 grams fresh thyme**\n- **15 grams fresh lemon balm (or mint if unavailable)**\n\n### Instructions:\n1. **Prepare the Herbs**:\n   - Wash the fresh herbs and gently pat them dry.\n   - If desired, chop the herbs to increase the surface area for better extraction.\n   \n2. **Decarb the Herbs (Optional but Recommended for Enhanced Potency)**:\n   - Preheat your oven to **77-100\u00b0C (170-210\u00b0F)**.\n   - Spread the herbs on a baking sheet and bake them for about **20-30 minutes** at the lowest temperature, checking to ensure they don\u2019t burn. This can help activate the phytochemicals in the herbs, similar to decarbing cannabis.\n\n3. **Create the Tincture**:\n   - Place the decarbed herbs in a clean, sealable glass jar.\n   - Pour enough **high-proof alcohol** (like **vodka** or **grain alcohol**, at least 40-50% alcohol) over the herbs to completely submerge them. \n   - Seal the jar tightly and shake it well.\n\n4. **Infusion Period**:\n   - Store the jar in a **cool, dark place** for at least **2-4 weeks**. Shake the jar daily to help the alcohol extract the beneficial compounds from the herbs.\n   - For a stronger tincture, you can let it infuse for up to 6 weeks.\n\n5. **Strain the Tincture**:\n   - After the infusion period, strain the herbs from the alcohol using a fine mesh strainer or cheesecloth, collecting the liquid tincture in a clean jar or bottle.\n   - Store the tincture in a dark, sealed bottle for long-term use.\n\n### Dosage:\n- Start with **5-10 drops** in a **cup of tea** (instant lemon tea would work well) or another beverage like water or juice.\n- Gradually increase the dose depending on how you feel. Effects are subtle but can help with **mood enhancement, mental clarity, relaxation**, and **creative thinking**.\n\n### Expected Effects:\n- **Sage and rosemary** will help with **mental clarity and focus**, making this tincture great for **daytime use** when creativity or introspection is needed.\n- **Basil and thyme** provide **mood-lifting properties**, helping with **mild euphoria** and emotional balance.\n- **Lemon balm or mint** will add **calm and relaxation**, helping to reduce anxiety and promote a sense of well-being.\n\n### Conclusion:\nWhile this supermarket-friendly tincture may not replicate the **strong euphoria** of THC, it can offer **mood-lifting, relaxing, and creativity-enhancing** effects. could potentially intensify some of its active components, such as **menthol**, which is responsible for its **cooling, soothing properties**. This might enhance its effects on **digestion**, **calming**, and **muscle relaxation**.\n- **Stronger Flavor**: Heating mint can release more of its **aromatic oils**, resulting in a stronger mint flavor in the tincture. If you want the mint to stand out in both taste and effect, decarbing might help.\n\n### **Using Fresh Mint**:\n- **Milder and Softer Effects**: Fresh mint will have a more subtle **flavor** and **cooling effect**, which may be preferable if you don\u2019t want it to dominate the tincture. Fresh mint still offers **digestive support** and **mild calming effects**, but in a gentler form.\n- **No Loss of Heat-Sensitive Compounds**: By using it fresh, you preserve more of mint\u2019s **natural volatile compounds** that might be lost during the decarbing process. This keeps the herb&#x27;s **aromatic freshness** and some of its lighter medicinal qualities intact.\n\n### Best Choice for Your Tincture:\n- **For stronger medicinal effects** (such as enhanced digestion, cooling, and soothing properties), **decarbing** the mint would be a good option.\n- **For a more subtle, fresh flavor** and **gentle calming effects**, using **fresh mint** would be better.\n\nIf your goal is to maximize the effects for your patient while maintaining a **balance between flavor and therapeutic potency**, you might want to **leave mint fresh** in the tincture, as the other components (cannabis, sage, and rosemary) are already quite potent.\n\n### Conclusion:\n- **Fresh mint** will give a more **mellow, cooling effect** with less risk of overpowering the other herbs in the tincture. \n- **Decarbing mint** could increase its intensity but might alter its delicate properties. \n\nFor most tinctures, **fresh mint** is likely to provide a **more balanced** and **refreshing addition**, especially alongside the stronger herbs like cannabis and sage."]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true

the active compounds in **rosemary**, as these compounds are relatively heat-stable at moderate temperatures. However, there are some considerations for each herb:\n\n### **Sage (Thujone)**:\n- **Thujone** has a boiling point of around **201\u00b0C (394\u00b0F)**, so the **77\u00b0C water bath** will not degrade it. However, extended heat exposure can cause a **gradual reduction** in potency, though it shouldn&#x27;t be a concern at 1 hour at this lower temperature. The heat will help extract the thujone into the alcohol, enhancing its effectiveness in the tincture.\n- **1 hour** is generally fine to release the active compounds without compromising potency.\n\n### **Rosemary (Carnosic Acid and Essential Oils)**:\n- **Carnosic acid** and **rosmarinic acid** are heat-stable at moderate temperatures, so they should remain intact. However, some of the more **volatile oils** (like **camphor**) might evaporate or lose potency if exposed to heat for too long. \n- **1 hour** should still allow for sufficient extraction of the beneficial compounds without degrading too much of the more delicate essential oils. \n\n### Should the Water Bath be Shorter?\n- **45 minutes** could be an option if you&#x27;re concerned about any loss of the more **volatile compounds**, especially in rosemary. It extracts **cannabinoids** (THC/CBD), **thujone**, and other active compounds relatively quickly. In 20 minutes, the alcohol can effectively extract most of the beneficial components without needing extended heating.\n   \n### 3. **Minimizing Compound Degradation**:\n   - While some compounds like **THC** and **thujone** are relatively heat-stable, other components can degrade if exposed to prolonged heat. **20 minutes** is often enough time to decarb and extract these compounds without risking degradation.\n   - A **longer extraction time** can sometimes lead to the breakdown of **flavonoids** and other phytochemicals, so a **shorter duration** preserves more of the plant\u2019s medicinal profile.\n\n### 4. **Quick Decarboxylation**:\n   - The **20-minute** time frame can also refer to **decarboxylating** cannabinoids or activating compounds in herbs like sage or rosemary. Here are some considerations:\n\n### Potential Pitfalls:\n\n1. **Inconsistent Potency**:\n   - Without precise measurements, the potency of your tincture may vary, leading to **inconsistent effects**. One batch might be much stronger or weaker than another, making it difficult to achieve predictable results, especially with herbs like cannabis, sage, or rosemary where **concentration of active compounds** matters.\n\n2. **Over- or Under-extraction**:\n   - If you&#x27;re not accurately measuring the amount of **herbs** versus **alcohol**, you could risk under-extracting the beneficial compounds, leaving you with a **weaker tincture**. Conversely, you might over-extract, leading to **excessive concentration** that could result in unexpected or overly strong effects.\n\n3. **Wasting Ingredients**:\n   - Using too much of a herb (e.g., cannabis, psilocybin, sage) could lead to **wasted ingredients**, especially when those herbs are costly or in limited supply. Precise measurements help make sure you&#x27;re getting the most out of your materials.\n\n4. **Difficulty Reproducing Success**:\n   - If a particular tincture works perfectly, it will be hard to **reproduce** it exactly if you haven\u2019t tracked your measurements. Without a record of quantities, ratios, or infusion times, creating the same effect again becomes more guesswork.\n\n5. **Safety Concerns**:\n   - With powerful herbs like **cannabis** (THC), **psilocybin**, or even sage (containing **thujone**), imprecise dosing could lead to **overconsumption**. This can result in **overwhelming psychoactive effects** or adverse reactions such as anxiety, dizziness, or nausea.\n\n### Benefits of Measuring with Precision:\n- **Control over effects**: You can fine-tune the strength of your tincture.\n- **Consistency**: Each batch will have predictable effects, so you know how much to take for the desired outcome.\n- **Efficiency**: You avoid overusing herbs and alcohol, saving costs and making the process more sustainable.\n\n### Conclusion:\nMeasuring &quot;with your heart&quot; is creative and spontaneous, but it can lead to **inconsistencies in potency**, **waste**, and **difficulty reproducing successful results**. It is perhaps most famously associated with **absinthe**, a spirit that historically contained high levels of thujone.\n\n---\n\n### **Potential Effects of Thujone**\n\n**In Small Amounts:**\n\n- **Stimulating Effects:** Thujone can have mild stimulating effects on the nervous system.\n- **Digestive Aid:** May help with digestion when used in culinary amounts.\n\n**In Large Amounts:**\n\n- **Neurotoxicity:** High doses of thujone can lead to neurotoxic effects.\n- **Convulsions and Seizures:** Overconsumption can cause muscle spasms, convulsions, and even seizures.\n- **Hallucinations:** Thujone is believed to interact with brain receptors that can induce hallucinations or altered mental states.\n- **Kidney and Liver Damage:** Prolonged or excessive intake may harm the kidneys and liver.\n- **Gastrointestinal Issues:** Nausea, vomiting, and stomach pain.\n\n---\n\n### **Can You Overdose on Thujone?**\n\n**Yes**, overdosing on thujone is possible, especially when consuming concentrated forms like essential oils, tinctures, or extracts made from thujone-rich plants. The risk increases when:\n\n- **Using High-Thujone Content Herbs:** Like wormwood or certain species of sage.\n- **Consuming Concentrated Products:** Such as essential oils or potent tinctures.\n- **Lack of Dosage Control:** Measuring &quot;with your heart&quot; can lead to unpredictable and potentially dangerous dosages.\n\n---\n\n### **Safety Guidelines**\n\n1. **Use Caution with Concentrates:**\n\n   - **Avoid High Concentrations:** Be cautious when making or consuming tinctures that concentrate thujone.\n   - **Dilute Properly:** Ensure tinctures are properly diluted to safe levels.\n\n2. **Follow Recommended Dosages:**\n\n   - **Herbal Supplements:** Adhere to dosage guidelines provided by reputable sources.\n   - **Culinary Use:** Using sage and other thujone-containing herbs in typical culinary amounts is generally safe.\n\n3. **Be Aware of Regulations:**\n\n   - **Legal Limits:** Many countries regulate thujone content in foods and beverages. For example, the U.S. limits thujone to 10 parts per million (ppm) in alcoholic beverages.\n\n4. **Monitor for Symptoms:**\n\n   - **Early Signs of Overdose:** Restlessness, anxiety, dizziness, and muscle twitches.\n   - **Seek Medical Attention:** If severe symptoms like convulsions or hallucinations occur.\n\n5. **Consult Professionals:**\n\n   - **Healthcare Provider:** Before using high-thujone herbs medicinally.\n   - **Herbalist:** For guidance on safe preparation and dosage.\n\n---\n\n### **Conclusion**\n\nWhile thujone-containing herbs like sage have beneficial properties, it&#x27;s important to use them responsibly. \u30105\u2020News\u3011 \n\n# FBI investigates Blackwater&#x27;s Erik Prince over alleged support for Haftar\n\nby  \u301023\u2020SafaAlharathy\u3011 Sun, 18/08/2024 - 14:14\n\n  * \u301024\u2020Share\u2020www.facebook.com\u3011\n  * \u301025\u2020Tweet\u2020twitter.com\u3011\n\n[Image 0: fbi] \n\nThe FBI has launched an investigation into Erik Prince, the former head of the private security firm Blackwater and an ally of former US President Donald Trump, over his alleged involvement in illegal arms sales and money laundering. The probe is also examining Prince\u2019s connections with foreign intelligence and military entities, including his reported support for rogue military commander Khalifa Haftar.\n\nAccording to the \u201cWashington Babylon\u201d newspaper, the investigation focuses on three main areas. Firstly, Prince is suspected of facilitating the illegal transfer of weapons to Haftar, a violation of the international arms embargo on Libya. Prince is alleged to have played a significant role in assisting Haftar during his 2019 attempt to overthrow Libya\u2019s internationally recognized government.\n\nThe investigation also scrutinizes whether Prince\u2019s laundered money is linked to his support for Haftar. The United Nations has estimated the cost of Prince\u2019s assistance to Haftar at $80 million, with much of the funding reportedly originating from the United Arab Emirates.\n\nAdditionally, the FBI is exploring the broader relationship between Prince and Haftar, particularly Prince\u2019s involvement in providing military support and operational planning for Haftar\u2019s forces.\n\nTags: "https://libyaobserver.ly/news/fbi-investigates-blackwaters-erik-prince-over-alleged-support-haftar", "text": "  * \u301019\u2020Education\u3011 \n  * Multimedia\n\n    * \u301020\u2020Images\u3011 \n FBI investigates Blackwater&#x27;s Erik Prince over alleged support for Haftar\n\nby  \u301023\u2020SafaAlharathy\u3011 Sun, 18/08/2024 - 14:14\n\n  * \u301024\u2020Share\u2020www.facebook.com\u3011\n  * \u301025\u2020Tweet\u2020twitter.com\u3011\n\n[Image 0: fbi] \n\nThe FBI has launched an investigation into Erik Prince, the former head of the private security firm Blackwater and an ally of former US President Donald Trump, over his alleged involvement in illegal arms sales and money laundering. The probe is also examining Prince\u2019s connections with foreign intelligence and military entities, including his reported support for rogue military commander Khalifa Haftar.\n\nAccording to the \u201cWashington Babylon\u201d newspaper, the investigation focuses on three main areas. Firstly, Prince is suspected of facilitating the illegal transfer of weapons to Haftar, a violation of the international arms embargo on Libya. Prince is alleged to have played a significant role in assisting Haftar during his 2019 attempt to overthrow Libya\u2019s internationally recognized government.\n\nThe investigation also scrutinizes whether Prince\u2019s laundered money is linked to his support for Haftar. The United Nations has estimated the cost of Prince\u2019s assistance to Haftar at $80 million, with much of the funding reportedly originating from the United Arab Emirates.\n\nAdditionally, the FBI is exploring the broader relationship between Prince and Haftar, particularly Prince\u2019s involvement in providing military support and operational planning for Haftar\u2019s forces.\n\nTags: \u301026\u2020Khalifa Haftar\u3011 \u301027\u2020blackwater\u3011 \u301028\u2020mercenaries\u3011 \n\n### Read Also:\n\n\u301029\u2020 \u3011  \u30105\u2020News\u3011\n\n#### \u301029\u2020Amnesty
